Are you looking for more than just a job and want to make difference? If so, then join the National Student Clearinghouse talent community and discover your impact today!
We are a nonprofit, nongovernmental organization and the leading provider of educational reporting, data exchange, verification, and research services. Serving the education, workforce and learner communities has been at the heart of our mission for over 25 years. Our work — performed in a trusted, secure, and private environment — provides numerous time- and cost-saving benefits to students, schools, administrators, and requestors.
About the Role:
The Senior Manager, Software Engineering will lead one or more product teams responsible for the development, deployment, and ongoing maintenance of the Clearinghouse application services. This role is critical as the Clearinghouse is modernizing its application portfolio to be hosted in a cloud environment from its current on-premise environment. The senior Manager is required to possess technical skill in order to lead the development team in providing comprehensive support for existing and new applications, and to provide leadership and expertise regarding methods, standards, and technical considerations for software applications.
The team to be managed will consist of direct reports and matrixed staff including developers, business analysts, testers, and data analysts. The Manager will partner with Product Owners and Business Executives to define technology roadmaps for Clearinghouse services and deliver technology solutions that meet the business requirements and are delivered on time and with the highest degree of quality. The successful candidate will perform all supervisory duties, ensure the team is staffed and fully prepared to deliver applications that meet the business needs, conform to technology standards/direction, and perform their job in accordance with company and division policies and procedures.
Currently, this position is 100% telework, however, as our company starts to return to our new normal, a hybrid work pattern, this position may be required to periodically work on-site at our office, and the frequency would depend on the department/division's requirements. Therefore, candidates must either reside within a reasonable distance to commute to our office, or be willing to travel to our office in Herndon when required.
